lines.text: Holy Chicago!
Will, that was incredible!
Incredibly foolish! You could have been killed Will Stoneman.
Well how many times is there an army truck in the middle of the street? I've been coming around this corner my whole life and has there ever been an army truck in the middle of the street?
Nice piece of runnin' there. So, how old are you pal?
Seventeen
Think you'll be ready to fight a war in a year?
I'm ready now, uh, war with who?
[Soldier laughs]
Stay alive buddy, your country might need you.
Your place is where your dreams are. Now you never forget that, never.
Look son, if you want something real bad, I mean you really want it, you've got to go out where you can find it and grab it.
Don't let fear stand in the way of your dreams, son.
[whistling Jack Stoneman's tune]
What you whistling?
I wasn't whistling anything.
It was your father's tune.
'Cept I can't do it like he did.
Maybe you'll find your own way.
I am one day short of the finsih line. Not you or anyone else is gonna stop me. So help me or leave me alone.
We started this together, we'll finish it together. It's the way it ought to be.
Once in a generation an athlete pits himself against such overwhelming odds that even the most jaded spectator finds himself cheering breathlessly.
Will, do you plan to continue with the race?
Not tonight.
We're barely making enough to survive, with no hope for anything better. I couldn't dream anymore about school. But when I saw this flier, I felt life getting back into me.
Mom, I want to feel alive. I want to feel like Dad's alive, right here. And I don't. I don't. Mom, he was going to do this for me. Now, let me do it for him.
Training begins now.
Ned? Ned, it's cold! Ned! Ned! Mom! Mom! Mom, please, it's cold! Mom, it's cold! Mom!
The first few days you sleep five hours. Then four, then three, then two. The last day you don't sleep. You just run. Run till the end.

You have to be strong. You have to learn focus, stamina, and balance. Only the smart ones will finish. You have to run longer and sleep less. It's your only chance. You'll make friends who arn't your friends, enemies who want to hurt you. Be careful who you trust.
How do I know who to trust?
Trust the dogs.

You have one chance. You must run at night when the others have stopped. Run with the moon. Embrace the darkenss. Grow hard with the cold. Put pain from your mind. And on the last day, when all will at night... you alone will be friendly with the dark.
Ten thousand dollars, Will. You don't have to die for it. If we lose the farm - ...
We'll lose it fighting. But we're not gonna lose it.
Just come home alive.
Will, I'm your best friend. Don't matter what crazy thing you do. I just wish you could win.
I'll win. You can bet all your money on that.
Do you think I can do this?
Matters most what you think.
I think you should come, is what I think.
Be strong boy. Be brave. Your father will be with you always. He lives in your dreams. Trust the dogs. Trust yourself.
I will.
When you come to face the thing you fear let the Creator guide you.
You're prepared to risk this young man's life to sell some newspapers?
Boy's got integrity.
You'll cure him of that in no time.
This race, boy this is the meanest stretch of land God ever put together.
You're gonna run 40 miles on fruit cake?
It's a special fruitcake Mr. Kingsley.
The boy has the heart of a bear.
Racing through the night, driven by his own iron will with a courageous - ...
Iron Will races to save mother's farm and go to college.
Have we come, so far that we've forgotton what it's like to start out with nothing but a dim chance and a bright hope? I will not be the one to snuff that hope gentlemen. Not I.
I may be young, but I'm not dumb.
